title: Picks & Bans: ahq's carries look to take MSI

replies.body: It's ok Taiwan got an article and eu didn't lol maybe someone from eu should write one...

Don't worry, EU will be coming in the next few days! :)

We'll have articles and videos for all the regions playing at MSI!

Hi.. Ty for noticing, but still....NA has like like 5-7 articles, even wildcards have their own, and now ahqs. Im not sure if few articles about MSI will fix it. Krepo ended his career, but still its "legend" Hai who we are reading first about (not like there will be any article about Krepo at all). Im EU and right now... it feels like im from oceania. Region riot gives a shit about.

Hai announced his retirement like a week ago while Krepo did it yesterday. It takes time to write articles. Instead of complaining go look to other site for articles on EU. There are many sites where you can find articles instead of just lolesports

I swear each region has their persecution theories about how Riot doesn't care about their region! Hell even NA has the East Coast complaining about how the West Coast is more preferred.

The only region that has a right to complain about being neglected is the North Pole. I never hear anything about them!! WHY IS THAT RIOT! CONSPIRACY MUCH!?!?!?!
But I guess Japan has nothing to complain about, I mean they have their own region, right???
Im sorry, but why should i look to other sites for articles about EU? With all the respect.  If you recommend me this, you are only proving im right.
(na.lolesports.com) dunno bro

The problem with saying "na.lolesports.com" is that even if you go to "euw.lolesports.com" you get the same articles. This season has shown lack of articles from EU and all the hype has been coming from NA.  Other regions have their own sites so they can have articles for themselves, however since EU and NA "operate" form the same site. EU fans will only see NA article being posted. If you visit the brazilian league page and go to esports you see alot of articles focused on the international wild card and even further back on the brazilian scene. You go to EU and you see nothing but NA articles with a few EU articles and international stuff here and there.

To be completely fair, Bjerg gets the most hype in NA, and everyone cheers for him. Which means in a way, EU is being hyped and recognized because you gave us NA's MVP. Be happy, because if any of your players matched the skill of NA's top players we would add them to our rosters too. 
_Almost like the worlds a buffet and NA is feasting._

The site is called na.~~~~ Obviously it is North American based and you can tell just by the articles. And honestly I do not think the Hai krepo point is valid because like someone said there is a time lapse between the two announcements. Articles take time to make.
Yay maybe I'll finally know what's happening in Europe :D

Just to address almost everyone who replied to this comment somewhere...

I'm not promoting region inequality, but to be fair, Riot is based in southern California, on the west coast of NA. So it seems natural, if not optimal, that they would preferentially address that region (more or first). 

Also, my comment's coming a bit late, as I just finished reading the EU article. So be patient, everyone, Riot has it covered.
Yeah, it's not like this site is **NA**.lolesports.com or anything
i feel like this has been pointed out multiple times; you may be viewing this on the NA site but the EUW and NA have the same content. i'm on the euw site and i am seeing no EU articles.

I think the reason the articles are so focused on NA is that NA is where most of the news is happening. 

In EU Fnatic takes the split, what a surprise. 

Krepo retires, that is news worthy, but it just happened, so news on that is still coming. 

That being said, the guy is 24 and has been playing professionally for a long time, it wasn't too surprising that after a disappointing split, he might step down, and retire. Not to mention it wouldn't be surprising to me if Froggen retired either as he's talked about it on his stream several times.

I'm not trying to be rude at all, but this season NA is where the news has been, not EU, that's why on a shared site the articles favor NA. EU just fell off the horse this year, I'm not sure why, but they did. That's really all there is to it.
Riot has proofreaders who haven't necessarily.

Cool article.

But I laughed. To pretend South East Asia can beat China and South Korea is a joke. Pure joke. Seriously, AHQ has no chance. "How to you deal with X player" ? How about you pit them against teams that are superiour at every single role with veterent status on many players ? This is almost as ricidulous as these articles pretending NA and EU won't get destroyed at Worlds.

This article is only meant to hype up MSI and to be fair there have been stranger things than a SEA team beating a CN or KR team. WE beating GET (IEM Katowice)? Kabuum beating Alliance (2014 Worlds)? HSGG not keeping his hot pink hair!

It is their job to hype every team in the event, it gets people riled up (as it has apparently done to you). As emotions get higher when/if any crazy events happen it just becomes that more exciting.

While the vast majority of opinions are they are going to be crushed (maybe rightly so) what's the harm in a little hype?

Obviously someone doesn't watch all the regions. TSM is looking to be on a similar level as the top Korean and Chinese teams. Who knows if they'll keep performing and improving as they have been, but for once NA looks like it can bring a fight to the top levels of competition. Don't believe it? Just watch MSI.
i bet 10 cents edg gonna take the victory

I saw a few of the AHQ games during their gauntlet and I actually think they are a pretty good team. In my opinion, the only reason why the Taiwnese top teams aren't better then the NA/EU top teams is because they used to play in the GPL prior to this season, where they really didn't have much competition, so they only play like 2/3 games where they really had to prepare. That's why they did so poorly internationally, where every game you play is hard. Now I can expect that in the future the LMS teams will be closer to the LPL/LCK level, first because they are close to those regions and can regulary play against teams like EDG and SKT (unlike teams from EU and NA), and secondly because of the LMS itself, where the teams competing are way better then the teams in the GPL.
I am not saying that Taiwan is better than NA/EU right now, but I wouldn't be surprised at all if AHQ wins games against Fnatic or TSM during MSI.

"With Albis moving from the jungle spot down to support, and Mountain coming in as the new jungler right before playoffs, AHQ has two players who haven't necessarily . Taking aim at them may be just the thing to get under the team's skin."

who haven't necessarily .
I was wondering about that; one of the images won't load for me either. Guess this article has a few little issues, but hey, they're busy, so I'm not gonna bother them now...
video looks cool
erm... the photo of albis and AN is wrong ~ AN the ADC is the one with short hair ,and Albis the support is the one longer hair :)
this is gonna sound pretty dumb...but for the life of me idk what champ that is in between urgot and naut..can someone fill me in? in the youtube video before you click to start it
That would be the feisty Sivir
{{champion:103}} Geez, nobody from AHQ, watching LPL final? I really can't see through how can they keep the faith to get MSI.....
finally he did it
That sivir splash art from the video..

did not notice that... wtf? I thought they unified all the splash arts now. Why is there a better sivir splash elsewhere? (i still dont like the newest splash, its just plain awkward...)

I really wish they would just unify the splash art.

At least put the right picture..the second picture is not their ADC, An; the guy in the second picture is their support, Albis, who used to be their jungler in the regular season. Albis took over the supporting role in playoffs after GreenTea stepped down from the starting lineup.
AHQ isn't taking anything....
inb4 Fnatic lose a game to AHQ. It's Kabuum! 2.0
AHQ are underestimated IMO. Wouldn't be on the level of Kabum though. Would have to be Besiktas beating Fnatic
Turks to take on the French/Dutch/Koreans of Fnatic! I could see it.
ya being "migrated" down to support, is a promotion in utility
the only thing interesting AHQ can show us at msi is if EU has fallen far enough to be below SEA in skill level yet....

Funny how EU has suddenly dropped to trash tier after 1 tournament. You haven't even seen any of the top 3 EU teams internationally. While we've seen the best NA team on a miracle run already.

Wether EU or NA is better then each other won't matter, like it never has. It's like comparing plat to diamond while Korea and China are on Challenger.

"With Albis moving from the jungle spot down to support, and Mountain coming in as the new jungler right before playoffs, AHQ has two players who haven't necessarily . "

Necessarily what? Proofread pls
compareing ahq to the worlds is like comparing bronze to challenger just cause ur good there doesnt mean youd be a challenger player
EU shall prove It's superiority at worlds.
